img.alt: Cylinder rolls down one incline and up the other

problem.p: A uniform solid cylinder is held at rest at the top of an inclined plane that has a vertical height \(h\) and makes an angle \(\theta\) with the horizontal. After the cylinder is released, it rolls down without slipping, then encounters a frictionless horizontal surface and then another, frictionless inclined plane that has the same vertical height \(h\) and makes the same angle \(\theta\) with the horizontal.

p.b: What is the minimum coefficient of friction \(\mu_{min}\) between the cylinder and the first inclined plane that enables it to roll without slipping?
